data.html: most private annotations are not useful to other people
data.text: most private annotations are not useful to other people

data.html: there are lots of problems with citation practices in science
data.text: there are lots of problems with citation practices in science

data.html: structured digital abstracts weren't really adopted (ppl publish, but don't formalize, their claims)
data.text: structured digital abstracts weren't really adopted (ppl publish, but don't formalize, their claims)

data.html: to be useful for other ppl, knowledge must be decontextualized
data.text: to be useful for other ppl, knowledge must be decontextualized

data.html: to be useful for other ppl, decontextualized knowledge must be recontextualized
data.text: to be useful for other ppl, decontextualized knowledge must be recontextualized

data.html: researchers rarely read whole articles; usually read very specific fragments for different tasks
data.text: researchers rarely read whole articles; usually read very specific fragments for different tasks

data.html: lots of prior work trying to use discourse/rhetoric models to improve IR of scientific articles
data.text: lots of prior work trying to use discourse/rhetoric models to improve IR of scientific articles

data.html: useful model for annotating discourse elements of scientific articles (somehwat tuned to gender studies papers). called SciAnnotDoc
data.text: useful model for annotating discourse elements of scientific articles (somehwat tuned to gender studies papers). called SciAnnotDoc

data.html: rule-based annotation algorithm can achieve high precision (but low recall) for discourse element annotation of full-text sentences in scientific papers
data.text: rule-based annotation algorithm can achieve high precision (but low recall) for discourse element annotation of full-text sentences in scientific papers

data.html: with discourse elements annotated and ability to search over them, researchers feel less likely to get too-large result sets filled with irrelevant things (vs. keyword search)
data.text: with discourse elements annotated and ability to search over them, researchers feel less likely to get too-large result sets filled with irrelevant things (vs. keyword search)

data.html: with discourse elements modeled, can retrieve desired elements at higher levels of precision than keyword search
data.text: with discourse elements modeled, can retrieve desired elements at higher levels of precision than keyword search

data.html: takes more time to screen answers when doing v specific queries (e.g., findings about x measured by y) w keywords vs. serach over modeled discourse elements
data.text: takes more time to screen answers when doing v specific queries (e.g., findings about x measured by y) w keywords vs. serach over modeled discourse elements

data.html: ClaiMaker is based on discourse relations theory
data.text: ClaiMaker is based on discourse relations theory

data.html: ClaiMaker is focused on modeling/capturing *relations* between objects`
data.text: ClaiMaker is focused on modeling/capturing *relations* between objects`

data.html: enable incremental/iterative structuring by providing "play space" and mechanism for "publishing" claims
data.text: enable incremental/iterative structuring by providing "play space" and mechanism for "publishing" claims

data.html: Mapping interface: ClaiMapper ties concepts/claims to documents
data.text: Mapping interface: ClaiMapper ties concepts/claims to documents

data.html: ScholarlyOntologies project supports some recontextualization of ideas through linkages to other ideas, but not to underlying substrates like data / sections of papers
data.text: ScholarlyOntologies project supports some recontextualization of ideas through linkages to other ideas, but not to underlying substrates like data / sections of papers

data.html: ClaiMapper/Maker was only evaluated by internal use by first author
data.text: ClaiMapper/Maker was only evaluated by internal use by first author

data.html: With argument modeling support, reader goes through three general stages of sensemaking, progressing from less to more formal
data.text: With argument modeling support, reader goes through three general stages of sensemaking, progressing from less to more formal

data.html: Many studies have shown that people move from rough sketches to coherent arguments during writing/sensemaking
data.text: Many studies have shown that people move from rough sketches to coherent arguments during writing/sensemaking

data.html: People spend more time to get similar amounts of "correctness" for answering sensemaking questions with a claim map of lit compared to using a written review
data.text: People spend more time to get similar amounts of "correctness" for answering sensemaking questions with a claim map of lit compared to using a written review

data.html: lots of problems with biomed scholarly communication and scientific work
data.text: lots of problems with biomed scholarly communication and scientific work

data.html: computational approaches have been proposed to deal with literature issues in biomed
data.text: computational approaches have been proposed to deal with literature issues in biomed

data.html: most statement-based models for compressing scientific ideas lack connections to evidence/context for statements
data.text: most statement-based models for compressing scientific ideas lack connections to evidence/context for statements

data.html: nanopublications have mainly been applied to v narrow tasks, but some ppl claim broader applications are possible
data.text: nanopublications have mainly been applied to v narrow tasks, but some ppl claim broader applications are possible

data.html: scientific reasoning/synthesis sits in a complex web of epistemic and social actors/forces/dynamics
data.text: scientific reasoning/synthesis sits in a complex web of epistemic and social actors/forces/dynamics

data.html: named entity recognition is foundation of one big class of approaches for extracting statements from scientific texts
data.text: named entity recognition is foundation of one big class of approaches for extracting statements from scientific texts

data.html: formal/probablistic grammars are a major class of approaches for extracting meaningful statements from scientific texts
data.text: formal/probablistic grammars are a major class of approaches for extracting meaningful statements from scientific texts

data.html: ontologies are a major approach to extracting/formalizing knowledge from scientific texts
data.text: ontologies are a major approach to extracting/formalizing knowledge from scientific texts

data.html: there is a lot of controversy about the illusion of consensus/uncertainty that ontologies come with
data.text: there is a lot of controversy about the illusion of consensus/uncertainty that ontologies come with

data.html: systems to help manage info overload from text should represent key parts of scientific arguments, as well as the context behind those parts
data.text: systems to help manage info overload from text should represent key parts of scientific arguments, as well as the context behind those parts

data.html: we need systems that can bridge the gap between the inherently nuanced natural language medium of scientific argumentation to more "computable" and formal smenatic representations
data.text: we need systems that can bridge the gap between the inherently nuanced natural language medium of scientific argumentation to more "computable" and formal smenatic representations
